text:
I think what this means is that Julia as a langauge is written in C, like most other languages.

However functions found in Julia.Base.

Such as sum, dot, append, etc... are written using the Julia language that wraps the C language.

text: Yeah, the basic answer is that all the core Julia stuff is implemented in other languages, and all the convenience stuff (built on the basics) is in Julia. Actually Julia takes it a step further by re-implementing some of the core stuff in Julia itself, e.g. integers.
